newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka tea hauliers call off strike.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka tea hauliers call off strike.

text.p: Sri Lankan tea haulage firms have called off their week-long strike after their demand for a 40 percent freight rate hike was met half way by estate firms, a union official said on Tuesday.

"At a meeting on July 6, it was unanimously agreed to accept the interim increase of 20 percent offered by the estates," V.M. Kandaiah, secretary of the Up-country District Tea Transporters Association, told Reuters.
"We have to wait and see and negotiate for the balance," he added.
The trucking firms went on strike at the end of June, demanding a 40 percent hike in the freight rate of 6.25 rupees per mile per tonne.
Tea industry officials said the auctions were largely unaffected by the strike as extra tea had already been ferried to Colombo in the weeks before.
Members of the four unions that struck work carry about half of the 5.5 million kg tea that is transported to Colombo every week for auctions, trade sources said.
